headline: Will WTW's Radar Deal With Sompo Transform Insurance Pricing?
summary: Willis Towers Watson partners with Sompo to deploy Radar, driving smarter pricing, client stickiness, and recurring revenues.

headline: Zacks Industry Outlook Highlights Brown and Brown, Marsh & McLennan, Arthur J. Gallagher and Willis Towers Watson Public

headline: U.S. commercial insurance rates ease to 3.8% increase
summary: Commercial Lines Insurance Pricing Survey: Q2 2025NEW YORK, Sept. 10, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- U.S. commercial insurance rates increased 3.8% in the second quarter of 2025, continuing the downward trajectory from the prior two quarters (5.3% in Q1 2025 and 5.6% in Q4 2024), according to the latest findings from WTW's Commercial Lines Insurance Pricing Survey (CLIPS). headline: Willis expands its Placement and Portfolio Solutions teams with two new hires
summary: LONDON, Sept. 10, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Willis, a WTW business (NASDAQ: WTW), has expanded its Placement and Portfolio Solutions team with two new senior hires. Gina Mulhall takes on the role of Head of Global Portfolio Solutions, including leadership of Willis’ Gemini facility, as well as setting the strategy for additional global portfolio initiatives. Mulhall joins Willis from Marsh, where she was Managing Director and Head of Quota Shares and Specialty Placement Solutions. Kapila Rudra jo

headline: Health Insurance Costs for Businesses to Rise by Most in 15 Years
summary: Costs for employer coverage are expected to surge about 9.5% in 2026, according to an estimate from  Aon  while an employer survey by  WTW  suggested 9.2%.  Both benefits-consulting firms’ projections, which were provided exclusively to The Wall Street Journal, would represent the fastest rate of increase since at least 2011, when the price tags for employer coverage were far lower than the recent average of roughly $25,500 for a family plan.  Other employer surveys conducted this year have generated similar findings—sharp hikes in health-coverage spending for next year, on top of two years of significant increases.

Other employer surveys conducted this year have generated similar findings—sharp hikes in health-coverage spending for next year, on top of two years of significant increases.

headline: WTW and SOMPO announce global partnership to deploy Radar for its non-life insurance services
summary: SOMPO uses Radar to accelerate data-driven management across pricing, underwriting and portfolio optimization, and with Sompo Direct Insurance Inc. implementing Radar as its rate calculation engine.TOKYO, Sept. 09, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- WTW (NASDAQ: WTW), a leading global advisory, broking and solutions company, and Sompo Holdings, Inc., one of Japan’s leading insurance groups, today announced a global partnership to deploy WTW’s Radar technology across SOMPO Group.
